alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cotton and northwestern Clay Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Temple and a storm a mile south of Taylor, both moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Temple, Randlett, Taylor and Charlie. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 3 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
